revised_title: Surface Effects on Viscous Flow of Liquid Films
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the extent to which the fluid properties of water and other liquids can be modified by the presence of a solid surface. They measured the viscosity of thin liquid films enclosed between flat polished surfaces and found that films of liquid crystals possess a high rigidity, while normal liquids do not show signs of induced structure even with very thin films and at temperatures near the freezing point.
